Code 
library(tidyverse)
library(countrycode)
library(WDI)
library(magick)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggmap)
library(maps)
library(mapdata)
library(magrittr)
library(gganimate)
library(viridis)

Getting the contries in Africa

We also need to fix some of the names slightly

Code 
countries = countrycode::codelist_panel
africa_countries = countries %>% 
  filter(continent == 'Africa') %>% 
  select(country.name.en, iso2c) %>%
  unique.data.frame() %>%
  rename(Country_Name = country.name.en,
         Country_Code = iso2c) %>%
  mutate(Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "Congo - Brazzaville", 'Republic of the Congo', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "Congo - Kinshasa",'Democratic Republic of the Congo', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "CÃ´te d'Ivoire",'Ivory Coast', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "RÃ©union",'Reunion', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "St. Helena",'Saint Helena', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name ==  "SÃ£o TomÃ© & PrÃ­ncipe",'Sao Tome and Principe', Country_Name))

Pulling the GDP info

Code 
africa_gdp = WDI(indicator='NY.GDP.PCAP.KD', 
                 country=africa_countries$Country_Code, 
                 start=1960, 
                 end=2018) %>%
  rename(Country_Code = iso2c,
         GDP = NY.GDP.PCAP.KD) %>%
  select(Country_Code, GDP, year)

Letâ€™s look at the GDP as a function of time

Code 
ggplot(africa_gdp, aes(year, GDP, color=Country_Code)) + geom_line() + 
    xlab('Year') + ylab('GDP per capita')

Lets get the map of africa.

Join it all together

Code 
africa = africa_map %>% left_join(africa_countries) %>% left_join(africa_gdp)

Putting it all together, a movie of africas GDP over the last 80 years.

Code 
p = africa %>%
 ggplot(aes(x = long, 
            y = lat, 
            group = group, 
            fill = log10(GDP))) +
  coord_fixed(1.3) +
  geom_polygon() + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  scale_fill_viridis() +
  transition_time(year) +
  labs(title = 'Year: {frame_time}')

anim <- animate(p)
anim_save("africa.gif", animation = anim)

# for(year in unique(sort(africa$year))){

# }

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning = FALSE)
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(countrycode)
library(WDI)
library(magick)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggmap)
library(maps)
library(mapdata)
library(magrittr)
library(gganimate)
library(viridis)
```


## Getting the contries in Africa

We also need to fix some of the names slightly

```{r}
countries = countrycode::codelist_panel
africa_countries = countries %>% 
  filter(continent == 'Africa') %>% 
  select(country.name.en, iso2c) %>%
  unique.data.frame() %>%
  rename(Country_Name = country.name.en,
         Country_Code = iso2c) %>%
  mutate(Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "Congo - Brazzaville", 'Republic of the Congo', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "Congo - Kinshasa",'Democratic Republic of the Congo', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "CÃ´te d'Ivoire",'Ivory Coast', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "RÃ©union",'Reunion', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name == "St. Helena",'Saint Helena', Country_Name),
         Country_Name = if_else(Country_Name ==  "SÃ£o TomÃ© & PrÃ­ncipe",'Sao Tome and Principe', Country_Name))


```

## Pulling the GDP info

```{r}
africa_gdp = WDI(indicator='NY.GDP.PCAP.KD', 
                 country=africa_countries$Country_Code, 
                 start=1960, 
                 end=2018) %>%
  rename(Country_Code = iso2c,
         GDP = NY.GDP.PCAP.KD) %>%
  select(Country_Code, GDP, year)

```


Let's look at the GDP as a function of time

```{r}
ggplot(africa_gdp, aes(year, GDP, color=Country_Code)) + geom_line() + 
    xlab('Year') + ylab('GDP per capita')
```

Lets get the map of africa.

```{r map, echo=FALSE}
world_map = map_data("world")
africa_map = world_map %>% 
  filter(region %in% africa_countries$Country_Name) %>% 
  rename(Country_Name = region)

```

Join it all together
```{r}
africa = africa_map %>% left_join(africa_countries) %>% left_join(africa_gdp)
```

## Putting it all together, a movie of africas GDP over the last 80 years.

```{r}
p = africa %>%
 ggplot(aes(x = long, 
            y = lat, 
            group = group, 
            fill = log10(GDP))) +
  coord_fixed(1.3) +
  geom_polygon() + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  scale_fill_viridis() +
  transition_time(year) +
  labs(title = 'Year: {frame_time}')

anim <- animate(p)
anim_save("africa.gif", animation = anim)

# for(year in unique(sort(africa$year))){
# p = africa %>% filter(year == year) %>%
#  ggplot(aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group, fill = log10(GDP))) +
#   coord_fixed(1.3) +
#   geom_polygon() + 
#   theme_minimal() + 
#   scale_fill_viridis()
#   print(p)
# }


```
